page.title: 08General Description (Cont)
page.content: in the same block. In block {D6}stands the " {New Inn}". Built in 1816,it gained local fame because of its links with incidents which occured during the {Rebecca {Riots}of {1839_1844}. In block {D11}on the B4306 road between Pontyberem and the village of{ {Llannon}stands the ruins of { {Marchoglwyn},a mansion that was built in the late 17th century.It was one of 2 mansions that existed in the area. The other {Coalbrook House}in Block { {D7}was built in 1672.During the second World War it housed a group of LATVIAN refugies who had fled from the German occupation of their country.Coalbrook was demolished a few years ago and rebuilt as a modern dwelling.In the heyday of the local collieries, Coalbrook had been the home of the local colliery owner.
